description:
Get the waffle cones here. They're so fresh and have the perfect amount of crunch. They don't have a huge ice cream selection here, but the flavors they do have are always good. I love the banana flavor and had the brown sugar one most recently. So yummy!

I'm still waiting for them to bring back the corn flavor- it's the best!!
author: Amanda F.

description:
Staff was pretty rude and disorganized.
I ordered ice cream in a waffle cone and they gave me it in a bowl,  so I askes about the cone and they had a very aggressive attitude. One of the girls in the back throws a cone at her co-worker, because of the angle it is thrown across the co-workers chest. Said co-worker is super confused so the girl in the back grabs the cone and puts it on top of the ice cream bowl and says "can you just eat it like that,  we're busy". Rude much? 

They also got my friends order wrong,  they confusingly asked her if she wanted the ice cream to go then when her order comes up they give her chocolate sauce in a take out box,  an empty cone and a bag...... Had to inquire about the ice creamand staff just kept saying "well you wanted it to go" then covered it up later by saying the ice cream was getting prepped.
author: Erica Z.

description:
I don't go to Smitten often because it's quite pricy, but as I was walking through the Mission, I saw they had flavors I've never had before, so I decided why not and treated myself. I always love how fresh and creamy the ice creams are at Smitten! 

This time, I got the matcha ice cream! My ice cream came out pretty fast, I'm assuming they had a bunch already made since I didn't see the machines churning after I ordered. Taste wise, this flavor was alright, it wasn't anything life changing. I wouldn't get this again if they had this again - I guess this rotation of flavors wasn't my favorite.
author: Stacey Y.

description:
I've been to Smitten multiple times but this was my first time at this location. I was walking along Valencia street and they had a nice sign outside with all the flavors. Me and my friend gave it a glance and we saw flavors that we had never seen before. Watermelon Cream, Pineapple Upside Down Cake, and Matcha Verbena were the ones that caught my eye. 

We ended up getting the Matcha Verbena with Stonemill Matcha in a cup. The ice cream was smooth and creamy like always and had a great matcha flavor! There was seating inside but we decided to walk and eat. 

I usually get the TCHO chocolate, but I didn't see that flavor that day. There flavors seem to rotate a lot, so they might not have your favorite flavor that day. But regardless, I enjoyed my ice cream and would come back and try their other flavors!
author: Michael L.

description:
Got the coffee ice cream in a waffle bowl - Taste: Delicious, can really taste the coffeee, waffle bowl.. was not as crispy and it should be... and when therefore when you're trying to eat it, it does become a bit of a soggy mess. $6.50

Bf got the cookie dough sundae in a cup - cookie dough chunks with pretzels in it was pretty good, actual cookie dough ice cream was pretty good $8

Minus a star, because the smallest comes with two scoops and you can't choose two flavors.  You also can't try the flavors, because they slow turn all the ice cream per serving in front of you, which is also their reason for the no mixing flavors thing.

Minus another star because they take orders by name.  They called out my order for the coffee ice cream in a waffle bowl and I saw another ice cream just sitting on the counter with cookie dough chunks in it.  So i asked, if this was the other one and the dude was rude and he's like "why would that be" and I'm like cuz I have a cookie dough one as well? (it's also rather warm and a lot of space, so it is easy to miss your order).  Apparently the second order just wasn't made yet, but he gave me a hard time for trying to figure out if it was mine or not, turns out it may have been no ones? or no one claimed it anyways in the 20 minutes I was in there.

It's also a bit on the steep side for ice cream... but I get it, it's "specialty" ice cream.  Cute little place though.  Small ice cream scoops, and to make it interesting it's $1 per topping and $1.50 for either waffle cone or waffle bowl.
author: Belinda T.

description:
Smitten is probably my favorite ice cream place in SF if I had to pick. That fresh made to order buttery waffle cone, the menu having not too many flavors, and their vanilla ice cream is the best I've ever had. When they had the strawberry buttermilk, oh man that was good. This time, I did the sprinkle and strawberry topping on top of vanilla ice cream. So damn good. 

My friend did the TCHO chocolate, he loved it. 

I dock a star because this ice cream is CRAZY overpriced, but the quality is so damn good.
author: Shruti D.

description:
Cleanliness: 4
Food: 3
Quality: 2
Service: 3 

I think that the nitrogen show is kind of cool and all, but the ice cream just tastes like normal I ice cream you could buy at trader joes. Basically, for the price you would pay for a half gallon of ice cream, you can watch a half pint of liquid quickly freeze with the texture of ice cream. The novelty quickly wears off after having the first bite of rather plain ice cream. I got the peaches and bourbon and honestly, it tasted like vanilla ice cream with the tiniest drop of peach flavoring. I tried my friends green tea ice cream and it was much better though!
author: Xuan L.

description: My friend and I shared a single scoop of the pineapple upside down cake with oat crumble, which was actually delicious and like a more crisp-like version of Dole Whip. HOWEVER - I think for hipster, expensive ice cream, there are much better options out there (I believe it was $8.....granted, it was about twice the size of a Salt & Straw kid's sized scoop which runs about $4 so on the same price point level. But if I were alone, there's no way I would buy anything). The nitro is a cool concept, however, I don't like that it prevents you from sampling flavors (I assume) and limits the menu to only a small handful of flavors.
author: Shelley P.

description:
3.5. Was it smooth and luscious? Yes. Have I had better, nary a block away? Also yes.

Strolled in after a din of vegan Japanese, place was busy but not slammed on a shockingly pleasant SF night. As A had been raving abt the cookie dough/pretzel/chocolate chip scoop, I was primed to dabble in this but ultimately commit to the chocolate ganache frozen delight, as I'm nothing if not predictable - but here we run into our first strug - it's all churned to order, no samples. Quelle horror. 

That said, on any given evening, they have 6ish flavors, all of which sound different enough that most ppl are bound to find something on which they can nosh, but still, vaguely bothersome to not be able to see if the matcha verbena tickles my fancy prior to spending $5 on a scoop. 

One of us went watermelon cream, another w the chocolate ganache, and a third w the cookie dough thing - the ganache was slightly salty and lacking that heart of darkness depth I was expecting from the Guittard cocoa jive it was talking. The watermelon was smooth and refreshing, not for those without a sweet tooth. I'm someone for whom ice cream eating is all abt the treasure hunt, so was was vaguely disappointed that the cookie dough, pretzels, and chocolate chips were finely blended in rather than scattered throughout, but we did manage to finish it, soldiers that we are.

If you want to get fancy, perhaps the prosecco/strawb sauce, TCHO chocolate drizzle, organic sprinkles, or homemade waffle bowls, will whip you into the frenzy that their actual slightly deflated whipped cream could not do for me.

I like Smitten, I do - and while the whole on-the-spot liquid nitrogen thing makes a nice treat, it didn't bowl me over. In a city with endless ways to spend $5-11 on ice cream, I'm not sure I'd abandon Humphry Slocombe or even Bi-Rite for a trend I suspect will be gone faster than you can say "damn, the Mission is full-on bougie now".
author: Rachel N.

description:
The chocolate ice cream here was actually impressively good, albeit it was a bit pricy for ice cream.

They make their ice cream using liquid nitrogen, and usually I'd dismiss that as just a gimmick, but this ice cream tasted exceptionally well, the texture was beautifully smooth and the chocolate flavor was amazingly rich.

Awesome choice, will need to be back to see what the other flavors taste like!
author: Tyler T.

description:
Hm... 'smitten' isn't exactly the word I'd use to describe how I feel about it. 

So, it was pretty good. I got some sort of peaches and bourbon thing that tasted good and definitely got points for originality. It was also definitely quality ice cream. But I think that accounts for the 3 stars that I'm giving it.

Here's why it's not a 5:

1. The whole 'liquid nitrogen' thing just really feels like a gimmick. I couldn't really tell the difference between this and normal, high-quality ice cream.

2. If I remember correctly, they only had like 4 options for flavors. I like ice cream places with toooons of flavors to mix and match with.

3. It'd be much more comfortable if they had an actual shop instead of a pop-up type thing with uncomfortable benches.

Overall, I'd probably come back if I was in the area and NEEDED ice cream (which happens a lot) but I wouldn't specifically crave smitten.
author: Claire C.

description:
Yelp 100 Challenge 2018
55/100

Pros: central location. Their ice cream is so soft and creamy. 

Cons: there was a hair in my ice cream -- they switched it for me and took it off my bill. pretty small scoops for the price.
author: Stacy A.

description:
I'd heard about Smitten Ice Cream for some time and never had the opportunity to try it till recently.  I didn't know they didn't offer samples, but understood once I grasped their concept.  I felt their prices were a bit much compared to other ice cream places, but I'm always game, especially when it comes to ice cream.  

I asked for 2 scoops, but the young man said I could only get 1 scoop, due to their liquid nitrogen process. I opted for the TCHO 60.5% Chocolate, since I can never get enough of chocolate.   It was cool watching how it was made, but it did take a bit of time, but I guess watching it is part of the price.  The ice cream tasted good and due to the process, was much more firm than other types of ice cream.  I also thought it was a bit creamier too, which I liked.

One of my friends ordered the Earl Grey and another ordered the Classic Vanilla with Strawberry Prosecco Sauce.  I liked the Earl Grey and it had just the right flavor.  The Vanilla was good, but the Strawberry Prosecco Sauce lacked a bit of flavor for my liking.  

Overall, I enjoyed the ice cream.  However, not being able to order more than one scoop was disappointing, along with the price and length of wait to get your treat.
author: Lon H.

description: If you are an Ice cream lover, you definitely should try this uniquely nitro made ice cream. There are a few Smitten ice cream shops in SF but the one in Mission is the biggest, cleanest, and most well decorated. It's fun to just observe how ice cream is made- nitro steaming, swirling, etc. It definitely gives you more experience than simply picking the flavors and eat it. Flavors change upon every visit but I  haven't been disappointed with the flavor that I picked so far. On the menu, there is a recommended topping pairing which gives you some ideas if you want to add something to your scoops. I personally always go for plain ice cream with no toppings. It's pretty damn good!
author: Adel A.

description:
Was 5 stars, based on the super rich Tcho 61% chocolate pint. Was expensive but so rich that it was like buying one huge chocolate bar. A couple bites was enough to satisfy that dessert craving. That was then.

Now, they replaced Tcho with Guittard. Why, why, why? Cutting corners? This is a $10 pint of ice cream. Actually $0 because, I refused to buy it. 

I could imagine the decision went like this: "Wow, our is chocolate is really popular! Let's swap out the main ingredient and make a little more money! I'm sure nobody will notice."

Move fast and break things, eh? Oh well, was good while it lasted.
author: iko o.

description:
I had a regular size Earl Grey ice cream today. It's good! Not sweet! Strong tea flavor. But maybe too real to the tea flavor, it's a little bit spicy or bitter (I don't know how to describe). The everything else is good! 
I will order some sweet flavor instead next time.
author: Yantong Z.

description:
I will be the first to admit I was a Smitten hater for a long time. I was unimpressed by the hype of made-to-order ice cream, and didn't appreciate paying $5+ just to wait 10 minutes to get a scoop of ice cream. I also didn't like that I couldn't sample flavors.

Recently I gave Smitten another try and was blown away by their corn ice cream because it was so smooth, creamy, unique but subtle, and delicious! Flavors are a bit hit or miss, I thought the vanilla and cookie dough was pretty mediocre, and didn't think the "chocolate crisp" was worth paying (kind of like an expensive chocolate rice crispy treat).

Expensive but delicious ice cream, will definitely be back now that lines are shorter!
author: Jess C.

description: I'm the type of person who chews my ice cream. Smitten Ice Cream has the perfect consistency where I can bite into my ice cream without tooth pain! I got the match verbena. It was soo bomb! Not too bitter not too sweet! Just right! Its fun watching the ice cream made fresh.
author: Ruhjeenuh Z.

description:
Vietnamese coffee with their own cookie dough ...

For what it's worth their cookie dough tasted like a dry dog cookie. 

How would I know that? Well when I was little I tried a dog biscuit on a dare so I would know.

Their cookie dough doesn't have eggs which is fine but it's extremely chalky and dry.

And the coffee ice cream was just average. Hefty price tag for the novelty of watching them make it in front of you.
author: Jack R.

description:
I just came from this place this evening and it is my first time visiting the location, I absolutely loved it! I ordered the caramelized banana with walnuts and decided to add the cookie dough chunks on a waffle bowl. I honestly don't understand why this place only has 3 1/2 reviews, especially after reading how silly some of the reviews are. Some people are saying the ice cream is "too fluffy" or "too big." I get that the portion sizes are big, but it's more bang for your buck! You are crazy little person if you are complaining about too much ice cream in your life! LOL

I was reading other reviews of some awesome flavors that they have, such as Earl Grey, so I can't wait to come back and try more from this cute little shop. The service was awesome, they even ended up giving us a free whole ice cream. And by some miracle there was no line, it was overall a great experience! I recommend this place to anyone wanting to try a creative and innovative way of eating their ice cream.
author: Alejandra A.

description:
A friend of mine told me to check this place out when I'm in the city so I decided go try it out because I'm really big on ice cream. The ice cream is made in the store and it's nitro ice cream. Their ice cream flavors were limited , so I ordered their cookie dough flavor. I didn't get a topping since it was an extra $1. Th small size comes with two scoops for $5, but can only choose one flavor (bummer). My friend ordered the cookie dough topping and I tried some and I def regret not ordering it my self! Lol.  The ice cream itself was on the sweeter side but you can tell it's freshly made and not sitting in a fridge allll day long. 
I would come back if I was nearby and craving ice cream , but wouldn't make a long ass drive just to go here specifically!  They also have a cute seating area outside with lights above if you want to chill and eat your ice cream.
author: Maddie A.

description:
I'm giving this place a 5 star solely because it's very delicious and fresh ice cream. At this location, I tried their creme frachie (without the pear). It was something simple but a bit more sophisticated than vanilla. The ice cream is creamy and not icey at all. A little bit of ice cream goes a long way since the flavor is great! 

A small size is $5, but seasonal is $6.

The price KILLS me!!! It's way too expensive for what it is. I can't imagine brining a whole family here and spending $30 of ice cream when you can spend $5-$10 at the store... however, you are purchasing quality ice cream at Smittens.
author: Joyce S.

description:
Meh. It's just ice cream that cost more because its gimmicky. Yea, the flavors tasted really good, but not as good as the prices would reflect. 

I also really didn't like that you could only put one flavor in a two scoop cup. My boyfriend and I wanted the exact same thing: half and half of the same two flavors. I get it, its artisan crafted or whatever, just not really customer friendly.
author: Mandy G.

description: Hands down a good experience. Open On a Sat. night, amazingly fresh and delicious treats.  Pineapple flavor was unique! Crispy waffle cone and fun decor!
author: Amanda R.

description: Got each pint size for Classic Vanilla and Upside Pineapple Cake. Upside pineapple was churned too much that the texture became like frozen butter. I can see little clogs in spoon after I ate them. I think this was a accidental mistake from Smitten but I am rating 3 since the pint costs $13.
author: Ren N.

description:
My favorite thing about Smitten is how industrial it looks.  From the slot for refilling nitrogen outside the store to the pipes that connect it to the giant tank inside.  And the nitrogen oozing out from the Brrr machines...  It is fascinating to watch.

I like their waffle cones and bowls.  However, I have not had any ice cream here that taste better than other places.

What I don't like about their ice cream is how smooth it is.  I know I know, that's the whole point about nitrogen ice cream, but I like the variety of texture.

I also don't like how fatty it is.  It leaves a greasy mouth feel.

Their berry sauces tastes like jam and I wish there is more texture in it.

Had I tasted all their flavors, I might have a reason to come back.  However, since they do not have tastings and offer only one flavor per serving, it could be a lot already after a couple bites.
author: Lisa C.

description:
Ice cream: 4/5
Service: 4/5
Ambiance: 4/5
Overall: pleasantly surprised by the texture and quality of the ice cream.  Definitely a good option when you want a sweet treat.

The extended review...

Ice cream: 

Earl grey chip - very smooth and creamy.  Despite the odd sounding flavor, I was delightfully surprised that it was light and tasty.  Who would have thought earl grey would be a great tasting flavor!!

Service: very friendly and attentive staff.

Ambiance: not much seating but there are a few benches.  Nice place to hang out for a brief moment.
author: Spencer Q.

description: I visited two locations of this small chain in the San Francisco area, I would highly recommend trying them out. What they lack in a variety of flavors they make up for in the quality. The mint chip has a very clear flavor of fresh mint and it's amazing, the vanilla is rich and savory, and they have different toppings available if you choose.
author: Chris D.

description:
This place is actually much bigger than other locations. Ice cream itself is the best I've had anywhere. I love the vanilla with strawberry sauce. Its a little pricey but worth it, also get a waffle cone/cup its really good.
They have some interesting history on the walls, about how this place got started.

They have a little bit of a seating inside and outside so its not a bad place to eat at (you dont need to rush outside once you have your ice cream)

They only have a few flavors at a time.
author: Arjan N.

description:
Smitten is one of the best places for ice cream in San Francisco (besides birite and Humphrey slocomb) and they are upping their game every year. The ice cream became much smoother and creamier over the years. 

The current flavors are great. Earl Grey is quite aromatic. Cold brew is authentically coffee infused without overdoing it. They have mastered the instrument to produce the best ice cream over time. 

This location also has single scoop size for $3.50 which is awesome for people who don't want to blow their sugar intake in one go!

The only downside of this place in Valencia is that it gets very cold inside during the night, when the employees keep them open to keep the client traffic in. One needs to eat the ice cream in the car to not freeze their ass off.
author: Rebecca C.

description: The experience is fun. Good place to gather and talk inside or out. We got a cookie dough and fresh mint. It was a good comparison because it shows the strengths and weaknesses of the liquid nitrogen method. The cookie dough was not fantastic. The cookie dough pieces were small and the vanilla was not sufficiently creamy. The fresh mint on the other hand was the best! Probably the best mint I've ever had -- and I usually don't like mint. The freshness of flavor is something you don't find even in the homemade ice creams. Hands down - get the mint. Even if you doing like mint, you will likely enjoy this one.
author: Ryan M.

description:
I was pretty disappointed at Smitten just cause I don't think it's worth the price nor wait. Me and my friends walked in cause the smell of their waffles was just too overwhelming to pass up. We ordered a brown butter (brown sugar?) regular in a waffle cone and it came out to like $8.50.... (what.). 

The ice cream itself took about 10 minutes to make and the 3 scoops were perfect smol little spheres. It was pretty good but nothing memorable.

Don't let the smell of the waffles deceive you!!
author: Yenny Z.

description:
Single batch made to order ice cream is definitely inefficient and a ploy of novelty. But the ice cream is quite good. 

My friend and I ordered a small cookie dough with pretzels and chocolate chips--it came with two small scoops so we split it into two cups and headed next door to Dog Eared Books to enjoy our ice cream.

The texture vaguely reminded me of Humphry Slocombe's secret breakfast flavor's texture, but instead of cornflakes, there were clumps of pretzel in super smooth ice cream, which I savored every bite of. The scoop lasted much longer than I would have expected.

The price is definitely very steep for the size of the serving, but in addition to delicious ice cream, you're paying for the fact this particular batch was made for you and only you. They also have quite unique flavors so that's a plus too. 

The store is quite spacious--could have more seating with all the space, but many people just drop by and leave after their ice cream is done, so it's not too much of a problem.
author: Breanna D.

description: Ice cream made with Liquid Nitrogen??? Say no more. This was a really cool concept to see. The ice cream is freshly made in front of your eyes where the person behind the counter mixes a bunch of your ingredients then pours them into the mixing bowl where liquid nitrogen is poured in during the mixing process. I chose the mint chocolate chip ice cream flavor and this tasted great. The ice cream here tastes light and fluffy and not heavy like the other ice creams out there. It's probably from the Liquid Nitrogen that gives it this type of consistency. It's pretty good but a little pricey.
author: Chris K.

description:
Smitten Ice Cream is like the little engine that could (please don't look that up in Urban Dictionary at work ok?). It started out from Kelvin, a liquid nitrogen-fueled machine sitting on a small radio flyer that made it rounds around San Francisco in 2009 and eight years later, Smitten has 8 bustling locations in the SF Bay Area.

Their eighth location in The Mission grand opened today. For their first day, all proceeds go to La Cocina (https://www.lacocinasf.org/mission). Love that and thank you for giving back to the community!

Smitten's liquid nitrogen made ice cream has rotating seasonal flavors. Today, they had Earl Grey, Classic Vanilla, Tcho Chocolate, Cookie Dough Lemon Gingersnap, and Turmeric Gold Latte. Prices for seasonal flavors (the latter two): Small - $6 and Regular - $7. Waffle bowl +$1.50. Cc's accepted.

Since they didn't have my usual go to (Crème Fraîche), I tried the Lemon Gingersnap in a Waffle Bowl ($6 + $1.50 for waffle bowl): http://bit.ly/2mxbfUN. 

What I love about Smitten's ice cream is the texture is always on point - super creamy, silky smooth, and nicely dense (no air pockets). The lemon gingersnap was zesty and tart with a good amount of gingersnaps for texture. Really refreshing but doesn't hold a candle to the crème fraiche with pear caramel...I like really simple ice cream flavors. 

Loved the waffle bowl - crunchy, buttery, and vanilla-y. It held up very well. When I flipped the bowl over midway just to eat the cone, it was still crunchy. 

Service was ultra-friendly and smiley on opening day so kudos for that. On my last two visits at their original Hayes Valley location, the customer service wasn't nice and I got a side of 'tude from one of the staff there. 

As for seating, there's a bench and a standing counter so you can people watch as you lick (no pun intended). There's also a public parklet outside so you can bring your furbaby. 

While Smitten's ice cream is solid, their pricing is a little steep. The same quantity and quality of ice cream (with unique flavors) can be found at Garden Creamery down the block for $2 less. Nonetheless, I would return to this location when they start offering Crème Fraîche again.  

So, what are you waiting for? Go indulge for a cause!
author: Cherylynn N.

description:
Cute little new ice cream place on Valencia right across from Xanath at Liberty. Smitten is a liquid nitrogen ice cream place - small batches and really rich and luscious flavors.

They had a long menu of different cool sounding flavors, except when we got there on Saturday night at 7 they were out of everything but chocolate, vanilla and cookie dough with pretzels.

No worry, the cookie dough was delicious with big chunks of cookie dough. The chocolate was super yummy. Even the waffle cones tasted fresh and crispy.

Ordered a small and it's already two medium scoops, so pretty much you don't need to much more.

Also fun to watch them make the ice cream in these little machines with spinning tubs and liquid nitrogen smoking all over the place.

Definitely would go back. Good ice cream and a cool little spot.
author: Bob K.

description:
I love ice cream and have found myself at ice cream places across the city. This location is very close to me so I find myself here whenever Garden Creamery isn't open.

The ice cream is good and they have unique flavors. My only issue is that the single-batch manner in which they serve lends itself to a very time-consuming ice cream consumption process. Not that I'm ever in a huge rush when I'm getting myself a sweet treat, but it's so noticeably that even when I'm in huge groups distracted by friends I still get a bit frustrated.

Regardless, I'll still be back here at some point. I just wish they could make it so I didn't have to wait for 10 minutes to get my ice cream each time.
author: Jenny D.

description:
I came to Smitten on a late-ish Friday night for a sweet treat after an improv show. I initially hadn't realized that the ice cream was made with liquid nitrogen, but the huge tank behind the bar and the open kitchen area definitely proved me wrong.

I got the Dirty Horchata, which was a flavor created in collaboration with the Boba Guys. One of my friends got the vanilla ice cream with strawberry proseco sauce. The texture of the ice cream was smooth--definitely smoother than your average ice cream. The horchata flavor was also pretty good as well and tasted a bit more like coconut and coffee than horchata itself, but was still good. The vanilla was pretty standard, and the sauce was nice and tart, but not aggressively proseco flavored. I think I'd expected a stronger flavor, but I still enjoyed it.

Despite coming right around closing time, the staff was friendly and didn't try to rush us out as they prepped to close. I'd definitely come back for a chance to sample some of their other classic flavors next time!
author: Catherine H.

description:
One of the best ice cream I've had!!! From service, ambiance, flavor... just the entire experience was a 5/5! I loved it.

My boyfriend started out with the brown sugar with cinnamon shortbread in a cup and loved it. It was so good that he went back to order the cookie dough with pretzels in a cone - WOW!! As if I thought it couldn't be any better. The cashier was super friendly at the front and I love feeling so welcomed.

The establishment was a little small and sometimes there's a line, but IT'S WORTH THE WAIT. This place is FIRE. Get the ice cream with the cone! You won't regret it.
author: Mary T.

description:
Gave Smitten a third try (different locations) and concluded that it's just not my thing. The quality of the ingredients is always excellent. But for some reason - blame it on the nitrogen? - the texture of the ice cream is too...fluffy?  It definitely is missing creaminess and density. Can you say ice cream lacks gravitas? I guess no one is going to give Smitten a Pulitzer or a Nobel Prize.  

Since no one asked, I'd probably bump this up a star if there were smaller portion-size options.  I'm not a fan of the Starbucksification of ice cream.
author: Joe B.

description:
Super delicious ice cream which is freshly made to order. It's prepared with a special machine using liquid nitrogen - not sure if this is the reason for its great taste. I chose the cookie dough flavor which contains small crunchy pieces of pretzels - yum! It's worth mentioning that even the cone is so good you'll want to eat it all. 

The small portion is two scoops which is definitely enough for dessert. It's quite pricey, but definitely worth the splurge. If you're feeling extra, choose one of many toppings available.
author: Silke H.

description:
SO SMOOTH!! This place approximates true frozen custard better than any other spot in SF-- if you look at the ice cream's texture, there are basically no bubbles/air pockets. YUM! My favorite flavors so far are the TCHO chocolate, cinnamon cookie (when they have it), and earl grey. 

Minus 1 star for having some mediocre flavors and also steep prices (I don't care for the horchata, or stuff with choc chips which I think ruins the smoothness instead of adding interest).
author: Jean L.

description: Probably some of the best ice cream I've ever had! My boyfriend and I went here on a whim and we both ordered the creme fraiche with pear caramel and it was so bomb! It really does taste like the perfect scoop of ice cream, texture and taste. The first bite tasted like heaven in my mouth.  I know this review sounds like an overexaggeration but please trust me when I say I try to keep all my reviews honest.  I also appreciate the story behind how it's all made. Go inside or look it up to find out.  I don't understand how some people gave it under 5 stars, maybe they're ordering the wrong things or they don't understand the concept of liquid nitrogen and how costly it is. Or maybe I just came in on a really good day, who knows?  All I know is that my ice cream was the most perfect and ideal ice cream I ever had. I definitely will come back for more.
author: Gwendolyn C.

description:
This is an update to my review before. I think in that review I was having a bad day. I returned to give it another try. This time, I truly enjoyed myself experience. 

Don't get me wrong, the smell of waffles does drag you in. It gives you very high expectations. But this time, it was better. I got a simple vanilla. It was nice, creamy, not to melted yet not to hard. It was just right. 

The waffle was excellent. The store was clean. I truly had a good time. One more experience like this and I might just give them a 5 star update.
author: Abu N.

description: My salted caramel ice cream made freshly in front of me. Ice cream was delicious but I felt was kinda pricey for two small scoops  for over 6 dollars.  It's a spurge.
author: Oanh L.

description: Smitten is high quality ice cream. They have usually 5 flavors a day. The cashier was so nice to me and gave me a sample plus recommendations. I ordered the Tcho chocolate and went all out with toppings, a waffle bowl, and their spicy caramel sauce. I'm an ice cream fanatic, but I'd say this place is a little overpriced and not thaaaat unique, but having said that, it's definitely gourmet ice cream and if you come when they have the flavors you like, you will be happy!!! Of course if you want gourmet ice cream, this place is a solid option.
author: Sela B.

description: We got one ice cream that was amazing and one that was kind of bitter and not as enjoyable. It does take a lot longer to get, but I mean...they have to actually make it. It's super fun to see the liquid nitrogen doing its thing, and I think this would be a great spot to take kids. Come here for the novelty, stay for the ice cream (the pretzel and cookie dough one!), but only if there isn't a long line.
author: Kari E.

description:
The ice cream here is really good! I've been to their other location in Hayes Valley twice and this location once. Their menu is more complicated in this one and I went with a huge group and everybody really enjoyed their ice creams.

The place is pretty big with a lot of room to sit inside and they even have a cute outdoor area just on the sidewalk where you can also sit and eat your ice cream. The place seems pretty empty usually and I've also walked by this place and there usually isn't a lot of people. Their ice cream is really solid and it's liquid nitrogen ice cream. Definitely not the cheapest, but it's cheap enough.
author: Christopher L.

description: Tasty icecream I ordered it on one of the hottest days of the year and the liquid nitrogen clouds saved me. I tried the sweet corn and topped it with raspberry. Intricate and delicious my only wish it that they would do like other liquid nitrogen spots iv been to in other states and hit it with gas in a bowl then hand whip it for a more fun presentation. Other nitrogen spots also let you choose the coldness up threw freeze dried astronaut style. Its tasty here but prepared internally in machines so it isn't much different then the standard experiance.
author: Sean G.

description: I loved the concept and then when we went in to order it was a fun and clean atmosphere. I was with little kids and they loved watching the ice cream being made! I tried a little bit of everyone's including getting my own scoop and everything had great rich flavor. The staff was super friendly and helpful. The only downside is it is expensive for ice cream but it's worth a try.
author: Brianna W.

description:
Liquid. Nitrogen. Batch. Ice cream... what?! I may or may not have been a little tipsy from two glasses of rosé before we went to get ice cream, but I was TOTALLY fascinated with how the ice cream was being made! Mad respect to the ice cream wizards who have to use upper arm strength all day to get that stuff out of the mixer. There's a bit of a wait time (5-10 minutes to order as the cashiers rotate with ice cream making, 15-20 minutes to get the ice cream), so make sure you give yourself enough time and put enough money in the parking meter.

My friend got the passion fruit and I got the cookie dough. Both = bomb! The waffle cones are so fresh and crisp. Two scoops = small! Three scoops = large!! I'll for sure be back when in the mood for fresh and creamy ice cream.
author: Melanie W.

description: Very cute location but relatively small with limited seating spaces. Known for their liquid nitrogen ice cream, Smitten was pretty decent. I got their Earl Grey and quite enjoyed it - a bit watery but acceptable.
author: Sharon F.

description:
OH. MY. GOSH. Their ice cream is AMAZINGGGG. By far one of THE best ice creams I've ever had in my entire life!! Get the Earl Grey flavor in a waffle cone/bowl and you won't be sorry!!! Let me just reiterate it one more time... IN A WAFFLE CONE/BOWL. Their waffle cones and bowls are freshly made in-house and go along so well with their ice cream. I personally like breaking parts of the waffle and eating it with every mouthful of ice cream. 

Also, it's pretty neat how they make the ice cream right in front of you!
author: Leslie N.

description:
2.5. I'd give it a 3 if I was generous but I'm not huge on Smitten. 

Compared to the Los Altos location that closed.. this is way better.

The other location would leave my tongue NUMB.. how on Earth is that enjoyable?!

Here there's still a numbing sensation, but barely. It's more enjoyable.. I don't get the smoke and mirror of the concept.. Like I just want my goddamn Ice Cream.

Guy tried to flirt with me for a tip. No thanks. 

-

The San Jose location leaves no numbing sensation whatsoever though.

P.S. IDK why, but socal peeps that I know love this.. yeah no. Haha. It's not the best thing in the world.
author: Lilian L.

description:
I contacted Smitten (the moment after basically devouring their website and delicious Instagram account) and asked if they'd do me the honor of providing the dessert station at our wedding. They shot back, "of course!" And, not only provided the best dang desserts of all time... they helped me make the Big Important ice cream and matching toppings choices, they coached me through my anxiety over said choices the week before the wedding, and they even specially-made my favorite flavor for me (mint chocolate chip). Then served it all with smile, 2+ hours away from their home base (after driving windy roads in the dark). Can you ask for more than that from an ice cream shop?

But wait, there IS more: To put the cherry on top of their perfect wedding ice cream execution... before they left at the end of the night they said, "we have one can of liquid nitrogen left. Wanna do something cool with it?" Cut to: our photographers lining up the perfect "end of the night" shot, the Smitten team unleashing their last can of awesome. And I even saw out of the corner of my eye, one of them MacGyver-ing a fan out of our wedding menus to waft the smoke upwards to make a killer photo op even more killer (er... "chiller"?). 

I'm BEYOND smitten at this point, I'm full-on in love with everyone and everyone involved with Smitten Ice Cream.
author: Megan H.

description: The ice cream was delicious. But I didn't like the cookie dough on the ice cream. Next time I will get it a separate container.
author: Lense E.

description:
This Smitten seems to have some growing pains, but it's expected for a business that has just opened. There are unique flavours for just the Mission location, which I'm eager to try. However, the ice cream here had a strange texture to it (and I've definitely had Smitten ice cream at other locations and it wasn't like this) that left a weird film in the mouth-- like the kind you get after eating too much whipped cream or other dairy products. My BF got the chocolate and his wasn't like mine (I had the brown sugar cookie one.) Maybe it was a fluke or it wasn't mixed well or was mixed too much? Maybe the ingredients were out of proportion?

Either way, I will come back to try other flavours but hope they improve the quality control and put out a consistent product.
author: Christa Lei S.

description: ryan be real nice, good technique, my boi right there killing the game. hands down 69/10
author: Ray L.

description:
Wowza!!! Smitten has me absolutely smitten! What a perfect name. The flavors were so interesting! I had the cookie dough with pretzels and chocolate chips. Talk about amazing!!  My mom had the earl grey and it was tasty as well!!

Only a very slight negative: I thought the price is a bit much for one baby sized scoop, however I'm still smitten over this spot! And clearly, so is the rest of San Fran!
author: Athena B.

description:
Alas, smitten has opened in our neighborhood! We've been waiting for months. After having sushi down the street, we decided to swing by and grab a cup of ice cream. We were a little disappointed that the flavors were scarce but it tasted amazing, nonetheless. 

It may be a bit dangerous to have a Smitten so close to our apartment, but we definitely will be bringing out of towners to check this place out!
author: Patricia T.

description: They are very busy but the service was fast. Loved the flavor and the texture of the ice cream. I tried vanilla with spicy caramel with roasted almonds and the flavors were very delicious! Will definitely try another flavor next time!!
author: Diana P.

description: Delicious ice cream. Music is too loud. Especially since you have to sit there and wait. I would dislike working here.  It's so loud the guests can't hear when they call out the order.
author: KMan ..

description:
Oh smittens, what more does life need when you have a delicious treat from smittens? The ice cream was delicious, enough to forget the stress of work and the pains of life. 

I work in the area and try my best to stop by once every couple of days. Cookie dough with pretzels and chocolate chips is my personal favorite. I have tried the majority of their ice cream and enjoy each one almost equally, but cookie dough has always been a favorite of mine. 

Parking around here is not the best, and is always emptier later on in the day. When I'm stuck at work and can not leave, i like to order through ubereats or door dash, which is surprisingly still cold when it arrives. I recommend smittens for anyone that enjoys a delicious treat and is ready to forget everything they thought they know about ice cream.
author: Andrew B.

description:
Oh man - total let down! They did a great job with the renovation. The place looks sleek. The liquid nitrogen process is novel but the flavor of the ice cream isn't that good. 

They offer a limited selection of ice cream. This week, they have not to be passed over (almond ice cream with wise sons macaroons and chocolate covered matzah) - available for one week only!

We also got the cookie dough with pretzels. 

Neither brought the wow factor. 

Onto the other 19 ice cream shops in the mission!
author: Stephanie C.

description:
Ice cream so nice I had to visit twice! 

Whenever I have my long weekends in Oakland/SF, I go a little nuts with the cheat meals, and like to try everything new (to me) that I hadn't tried before. 

My friend brought me here, where factory machines set the backdrop to smells of sweet, creamy delights. 

I had the strawberry marscapone in the waffle cone not once, but twice. No regrets. The service was awesome, and I really enjoyed them explaining the whole novel process of making the ice cream using liquid ice cream, "churned to order". 

Wish they had one in my neck of the woods!
author: Lesta I.

description: disappointed! Just feels like this place is overrated and a bit overpriced. I got the Earl Grey with Chocolate Chips--wasn't as good as Bi-RIte's Earl Grey flavor and I feel like the chocolate chips makes it a really confusing combination. Happy I tried it and it was a nice treat but don't think I'd go back.
author: Nerissa C.

description:
Surprisingly good!  

I've tried Smitten before at catered events, and I've had other liquid nitrogen ice cream, and I've always been disappointed.  It's always seemed either over-frozen or gritty or just texturally unpleasant.  

With their set up here, having liquid nitrogen constantly mixed into the dairy base by machine creates a product that is rich, smooth, and delicious.  

The flavors are all intense and the ingredients are clearly very high quality.  The TCHO chocolate ice cream in particular is so rich and wonderful.  Their waffle cones and bowls are a nice option, though I tend to stick with a standard paper cup.

My only gripe would be with the add-ins and the utensils.  First, the cookie dough is way too large and hard, and it sits on top of the ice cream instead of being incorporated into the ice cream.  You'd think they could add it into the ice cream blend near the end of the blend cycle, but since I could see that presenting issues with respect to cleaning the machine between each order, I'd at least like to see the cookie dough be in bite-sizes so I could actually eat it along with each bite of my ice cream.  Second, the spoons are absurd.  They are literally sample-sized baby spoons with blunt, square tips.  Maybe if I had a regular-sized spoon, I could have broken apart my massive chunks of cookie dough and incorporated them into my ice cream...

Overall though, this was fun and super tasty.  I'll be back!
author: Tay H.

description: First day opening. Staff were super friendly. Though you can tell some staff are still being trained to make the ice cream and use the machines. I got the cookie dough and there wasn't enough cookie dough or chocolate chip in it. The marketing manager? Came by to ask for feedback and I let him know. At one point the store had to close due to their payment system that was not working. Luckily I got there prior to that. Look forward to returning for some ices cream. There are a few competitors in the area such as garden ice cream themselves which are real really good.
author: Carmen L.

description: The Ice Cream is good no matter what location you go to. The customer service is the difference. A kind of fake warm vibe as I went to order. Maybe she was having a bad day or was in a hurry but they were no busy. Just a little more of a genuine smile would have been nice. It was a nice day outside.
author: Sabrina V.

description: It's ice cream... simple, sweet and a smile worthy word in any weather. The employees could use a bit of happy in their attitude . Ugh
author: Krishnaja G.

description: Yum! I had one of the specials, salted caramel ice cream with chocolate sauce and cookie dough crumbles and it was delicious and just enough to top off a light lunch. This a nice little local place, and I received my order promptly.
author: Caterina F.

description: Worst ice cream. Walgreens has better than that. Incredible that people pay money for that
author: sibylle s.

description: Eh! Cool concept... with the smoke and all. And the ice cream is delicious as well. However, at $5 for small and extremely limited options it's not worth it. Instead go to bi-rite - so many options and better pricing!!
author: Raj S.

description: Cool seeing the way they make your ice cream, but more importantly, the ice cream itself was amazing. The chocolate flavor was creamy, not too sweet, and just delicious. Will be going again.....
author: Imran R.

description:
Ice cream is one of my favorite things in the world. I have a great distaste for gimmicky things like rolled ice cream. I was at first skeptical of freshly churned ice cream. It seemed like just another toy with some liquid nitrogen. BUT, this is damn good. This is some of the smoothest ice cream I've ever had. They use organic milk and cream so it's a good quality base too. There's only a couple of flavors available per day but there's a good variety. On top of that, this location wasn't busy at all so I didn't have to wait long either. 

For those interested in why I have such a distaste for rolled ice cream and the science of why Smitten works, read on. In order for ice cream to be smooth, you need to get the ice crystals to be super small. This means either having higher milk fat or egg yolks that act as stabilizers and emulsifiers.  Gelato on the either hand compensates the lower milk fat  by churning for longer. It also has a shorter shelf life for the same reason. Because Smitten uses liquid nitrogen, the fastest readily available cooling agent, it allows the cream to freeze super fast while attaining smaller ice crystals. Add a little agitation and you get air in the cream which adds to the smooth velvety feeling in your mouth. Rolled ice cream on the other hand involves pouring cream on a anti freeze griddle which isn't as fast or cold as liquid nitrogen and there's very little air introduced when it's pressed and re-scraped. Rolled ice cream falls short of being novel whereas Smitten's machine may be the coolest new innovation on ice cream in a long time.
author: Regina C.

description: This was my most favorite ice cream place in my trip to san fran. They only have 6 flavors, I chose the brown sugar with cinnamon shortbread and it was so good. I wish I could have brought it back to NYC with me. They have a station for each flavor, they pour the liquid batch into a bowl and it start churning with nitrogen and your ice cream is created fresh in front of you. The ice cream was so smooth and creamy but not heavy. So good!!! When I come back to San Fran, definitely coming back
author: Ann S.

description: Best ice cream! interesting to see how they make it. I had lemon cream flavor, which is a seasonal item, and liked the creaminess with the tart lemon flavor.
author: Lorely G.

description: One word: fabulous. I was amazed by how special the flavours were and how rich the ice cream texture was! Definitely try the flavours 60.5% Chocolate and blood orange, you won't be disappointed.
author: Tiffany T.

description: Good place to have an ice cream. Original flavors. Just a bit expensive... But they are made in front of you, which is pretty cool :)
author: Clémentine C.

description:
I heard great things about Smitten and was very excited to give it a try while in town. It was a big let down. I ordered the brown sugar with cinnamon shortbread with caramel and krispies in a waffle cone. 

The texture was horrible - it was grainy and felt like the ice cream was not fully frozen.
The waffle cone on the other hand was very delicious and you can tell it was fresh, definitely way better than the ice cream.

Overall, very overpriced and not worth the hype.
author: Caroline M.

description: Ice Cream and donuts is what we've been eating for the last three weeks from Seattle to San Fran. This is the first time I've bothered to review while still in the store - best ice cream! Using fresh and real ingredients truly makes a world of flavor difference. Having the ice cream churned for you is crazy labor intensive but the creaminess in every bite is worth every second of the wait. Had chocolate, mint (holy cow - amazing mint!!), cookie dough, and peach bourbon with the suggested toppings. All before noon. Love the people, decor, science and flavors.
author: laurie s.

description:
I don't get the fuss about the ice cream here. The freshly-made-via-fancy-apparatus gimmick doesn't seem to enhance the flavor. If anything, I thought there was a certain monotony to the texture after a couple of spoonfuls and I regretted not adding any toppings to the fairly large single scoop. 

I'll probably return to try out a different flavor, but there's definitely better ice cream to be had within a mile of Smitten.
author: Karthik R.

description:
I'm pretty sure their waffle cones/bowls are made of crack, because why else would I pay $7 for one ice cream?!

To be fair though, their portion sizes are pretty generous (a small actually has 2 scoops, a large is 3). This location usually has 4-5 different flavors (2-3 seasonal ones and their standard flavors). I just wish they offered samples so I can try before committing to one!

Loved the chevre & apricot flavor - please bring it back!!
author: Vivian H.

description:
I've loved all of Smitten's locations, so I was genuinely surprised by my experience at their new Mission location. 

- flavors were "meh" compared to the TCHO Chocolate that I've had at their other locations
- months late in opening
- customer service was poor, the employees didn't seem to want to be there nor help the customers. Fairly certain they were gossiping about a couple Smitten customers that were standing outside
* the guaranteed star because of the liquid nitrogen process
author: Paige S.

description: I heard great things about Smitten's, so I was expecting a better product especially for the price. It's not your traditional ice cream place, so they don't have samples or a huge variety of flavors. I got the chèvre with an apricot sauce. It was lacking the funk I wanted from the goat cheese and was rather bland. It tasted like sweet cream. (Salt and Straw has a much tastier goat cheese ice cream) I didn't finish my little cup, which is unfortunate since I paid $7 for it. In this city with great ice cream, I won't be coming back to this place.
author: Kim W.

description:
I am smitten with Smitten's ice cream! 

Food: Their 60.5% chocolate ice cream was slightly sweet and the ice cream itself had a nice hardness to it when taking a bite! 

Interior: The interior was clean and it was cool to watch them make the ice cream! They had a nice area to sit and relax or you could eat outside as well to enjoy the weather. 

Price: Though t is on the higher price end for ice cream, it was delicious!  would recommend!!
author: Justina H.

description: Hate it when ice cream parlours over promise and under perform. Especially at this price range. Very expensive and very very average. Had the ginger snap and wouldn't recommend it
author: Ashmita V.

description:
I want to give smitten a 5 -star rating and I would if: 

- they let you combine flavors. 3 scoops of 1 flavor is just blah no matter how creamy the ice  cream is! 
- they dropped their price by $2 

They are more expensive than garden creamery and bi-rite which are just around the corner and have amazing ice cream at less cost.
author: Hema P.

description:
I reaaaally wanted to like Smitten Ice Cream more than I did. Why? Because the flavors sounded bomb, their branding is on point, and who doesn't love liquid nitrogen!? Unfortunately, the ice cream turf wars are in full force around Valencia, and Smitten's got some stiff neighborly competition. 

I was hoping for Salted Caramel upon arrival, but it was not available at the location. No biggie. I decided to try the Blueberry Lavender, because blueberry AND lavender are some of my all time favorite flavors. It's also important to note that you can't get more than one flavor per serving. My guess is this is due to a quantity thing. Again, no biggie. I asked if the Brown Sugar Caramel would be a good pairing, and the cashier said that a lot of people were getting the recommendation pairings. I did not even see this part of the menu, because honestly the menu was not that easy to read. Black font on gray background... why!? Oh, another design note - having the cashier on the right side of the shop felt odd to me. Ok, so besides these not so big design woes, let's get back to the flavors. 

The Brown Sugar Caramel was a good choice for topping, and I enjoyed it, however the flavor was a bit subtle. As for the ice cream, what I wanted to be a somewhat deconstructed taste on my palette - meaning hints of blueberry and hints of lavender - was instead a weird melding of blueberry and lavender that didn't taste wonderful together. I was expecting chunks of blueberry and pops of lavender, not the blending I received, both flavor and texture wise. The blueberry tasted a little too sweet, and the lavender didn't hit me enough. I had to really search for the individual flavors on my tongue, which is not the experience I want when eating ice cream. The waffle bowl was delicious, but if I had not gotten the bowl, I don't think I would have even finished my two scoops.

Props for the pops - the vegan options are Vegan pops - but there are more, delicious vegan ice cream options literally within a block.

As far as service, it was meh. It didn't seem like the cashier cared at all what I ordered, they were not very friendly, and wouldn't mind if I just walked away. I also didn't get the waffle bowl I ordered and had to ask for it. This wasn't a big deal, but it made the impression that the staff was a bit disorganized.

I'm willing to give Smitten another try, perhaps at a different location, and perhaps once they've finely tuned their flavors.
author: Erin W.

description: The cashier was so friendly and helpful! We got the mission only chevre apricot jam and earl grey milk chocolate. Both flavors were PERFECT. We got munchkin scoops so that we could enjoy both. Definitely will come back.
author: Caroline K.

description: I was craving ice cream but literally walked right out when I saw the prices. $6 for a small and $7 for a regular size? That's absolutely absurd for just a base flavor. WTF Smitten?
author: Cara R.

description:
So yum!
Glad they are branching out. 
This location has a specialty "turmeric gold latte". 
It was abbot too strong for my taste buds, but with the chocolate, it was YUM!!!!
author: M J.

description: Clean interior and cool local flavors like Cold Brrrrew (my favorite, since it is not too sweet and has a deep coffee flavor) and Mission Hot Chocolate, a partnership with Dandelion which was a bit too spicy for me. A small in a waffle cone is not cheap (about $7) but they give you two scoops, which was plenty for me and my fiance to share. You can also buy by the pint, which takes about ten minutes for them to make.
author: Christina G.

description: This location is disappointing. I'm a big fan of Smitten but my experience at this location was sub par. Still gets three stars (it's ice cream after all) but instead of the fresh made I'm used to from other locations, my order here was pulled premade out of the freezer, was chunky, and had ice crystals in it. Their pitch is that the single batch liquid nitrogen process makes a smoother ice cream... didn't deliver this time.
author: Andrew S.

description: I ordered the TCHO chocolate. Tasted creamy and good for me. It's a bit pricey though at $7/scoop but then again what isn't overpriced, for the most part, in this neighborhood. I opted to get a cone which was good with the ice cream. It's neat that you get to see them put your ice cream from their nitro machine to your cone.
author: Gerard Y.

description: I like the concept of the store, making ice cream with nitro right then and there. However, the ice cream was really hard and it took a while for us to finish. It tasted rich but was overpriced.
author: Sabrina L.

description:
I was a little underwhelmed by the flavour of their ice creams. They also ran out of waffle bowls at 7:30pm on a weeknight, and the advertised seasonal flavour of the moment, was also not available. Honestly, they shouldn't advertise items on their menu if it's not going to be available.
The Tcho flavour, even though it contained 60% cocoa, did not have an intense chocolate flavour. The Early grey and choc chip ice cream had a hint of bergamot and tea flavour, but it was too subtle and overpowered by sweetness.  The waffle cone also was like eating a pound of sugar. Overall, it was average.
author: Kevin M.

description: Overpriced for ice cream that is only fine, not amazing. The machines are super gimmicky. Also the spoons are tiny compostable sticks that bend when you try to scoop the ice cream. The whole thing feels ridiculous.
author: Marianna M.

description: Everything you want in an ice cream shop. It has a really cute vibe and has the perfect aesthetic for quality Insta pics. The ice cream was so good. I had the Tcho Chocolate and it was absolutely delicious and very smooth. Loved it!
author: Jesse S.

description: Updating the review as the manager at the business approached, admitted to the confusion and made an effort to rectify it. We love the ice-cream here. The space is open, nicely laid out and clean. Have already gone back again and will continue to try their seasonal flavors.
author: Chet L.

description: Love Smitten's but seriously what ice cream shop runs out of Vanilla???!! Out of all the flavor they had to offer they only had two!! I'm giving them a three star review because the guy at the register felt embarrassed that every time my friends and I would choose a flavor the answer was "oh sorry we're out" but seriously if it wasn't for him I would have given the a negative star!
author: Kimberly P.

description:
Friendly staff.
Small place but they have a parklet outside.
Love the smooth texture of their ice cream.
The cost to portion value is slightly high but it's the Mission.
author: Evan W.

description: Sooooooo..... wanted to try something new, and was on a date with my man and we came here after dinner. He was told he couldn't get two flavors...and they only had five to choose from. Over-hyped hydrogen made ice cream. Not that great texture wise. And expensive. Do yourself a favor, and skip it. (Plus, family owned, SF staple, Mitchell's, with award winning ice cream... Is less than ten blocks away) I ended up getting the Vietnamese coffee, in a waffle cone. It was average, the ice cream, and the cone. (Cone was kinda soft, and ice cream was leaking from the bottom...)
author: Caitlin S.

description: Every eatery has a few places that make it.   This place,  if it ever went out of business,  would take with it probably the best chocolate ice cream ever.  Sure the other flavors are different,  some are good, some ok, but I just get a pint of their choco.  Yeah it's expensive,  but you're in sf, don't act like the other over priced crap here like tartine or some dumb boba tea joint is worth it but really not.. .this actually is.
author: A A.

description: Ice cream was so good! We got chocolate chip cookie dough with pretzels and cinnamon with shortbread in waffle bowls. The bowls were warm and crispy. Not badly priced either, $5 for two scoops in a waffle bowl.
author: Allison B.

description: Way too expensive.  Quality does not match price.
author: David H.

description: The portion size was small and definitely not worth the money. I ordered the ice cream with cookie dough with pretzels mixed in, but it just tasted like average vanilla ice cream (I couldn't even taste chunks). The place is definitely very aesthetic but overall wouldn't go again.
author: Aarthi M.

description: Soo happy to have this new store open on Valencia! I've now been 3-4 times in the same number of weeks..! You really can't go wrong with the traditional pretzel + cookie dough combo -- it's sweet, salty, and chocolatey at the same time. Match made in heaven. Plus it's a really neat experience, seeing the way they make your dish right in front of you, liquid nitrogen and all. It's all in the science, right?!
author: Steffan P.

description: Smitten got back to me, actually in a timely manner, apparently the first email didn't get through. They were very concerned and are continuing to research where the buckwheat may have come from, and supplied us with ingredient lists and sources for all products used. Definitely will give them another try now!
author: Dore C.

description: I love Smitten Ice Cream but this location was disappointing on an overall experience level. For starters, the pricing here is choking bananas. A small (2 scoops) of their seasonal flavors will run you $7.00. But, I will say, the Lemon Gingersnap was pretty good. In addition to my Lemon Gingersnap I ordered a Classic Vanilla that explicitly states on the menu that it comes with strawberry prosecco sauce and all-natural rainbow sprinkles. After waiting roughly 10 mins the guy hands me a plain vanilla with no toppings. I asked him for sprinkles and he responds "WHAT? you want sprinkles?" and he begrudgingly sprinkles them on. Then, I had to ask for the strawberry sauce. Seriously, there's only like 6 different flavors on your menu, make an effort to memorize them. And for $7-$8 bucks I can do WITHOUT your millennial sass.
author: Yuxuan N.

description: I ordered a earl grey tea ice cream that was suppose to come with the chocolate rice crispy topping but it did not come with the topping. I told the guy who made it that it was suppose to come with it but he said it wasn't part of my order. I asked him again if I can still get it but he refused to give it to me. I already paid for it! Why can't I get the topping?!? The ice cream market is very saturated. Your not the only ice cream place. Garden Creamery is only a block away and is just as good with sooo many more flavors. Your not the only ice cream place that has earl grey tea. Bi rite creamy also has a bomb ass earl grey flavor.
author: Nika L.

description: This place as just as great and amazing as the Octavia street one. The staff are super friendly and ordering was easy, fast, and simple. The prices were a little expensive, but it was totally worth that when I tasted the ice cream! I would give it 6 stars if I could!
author: Summer B.

description: Fresh ice cream made right in front of you. They don't just take out scoops of ice cream from the cooler like most other places. The 60.5% TCHO CHOCOLATE was melting in the mouth. It was delicious. The wine ice cream wasn't really great. But all the other flavors are worth craving for. Highly recommend this place!
author: Shashank R.

description: Using liquid nitrogen to make ice cream gives a much more creamy texture, and basically tastes like how ice cream should taste! My favorite was the cookie dough. Their chocolate wasn't as POW-amazing as i hoped. Still a solid choice for a warm day, or night.
author: Tim B.

description: Their special preparation technique gives the ice cream a unique, velvety texture that can't be beat. The flavors are simple but done to perfection.
author: Norcloud S.

description: The novelty of Smitten is that their ice cream is made-to-order with liquid nitrogen.  That is very cool and fun to watch.  Unfortunately the ice cream does not live up to the production.  I had the Meyer lemon and it seriously lacked lemon flavor.  They add the lemon juice to the ice cream base when they freeze it.  The primary taste was sourness with faint lemon in the background.  Not really Meyer-y.  Very disappointing.  My friend had cookie dough which tasted malty.  She didn't like it.  The bottom line is that the actually ice cream is not worth the high cost.
author: Lisa L.

description: Poor way to deliver a decent product. Took way too long when there were 2 customers in the store. It was nice that the worker gave me a free topping for having to wait so long. You can't have one machine for each flavor. Customers will get frustrated having to wait so long! I'd much rather go to Garden Creamery. Too bad they were closed today.
author: Lee U.

description: Rich, delicious chocolate ice cream (60.5% chocolate). I've never had ice cream made for me while I wait. Not without having to hand-crank for a very long time. This took a couple of minutes and it's quite a show!
author: John B.

description: We have tried this place twice. The first time we tried the earl grey ice cream, and although the wait was long (and the ice cream pretty pricey), you could appreciate the process and price, as the result tasted delicious and we were pretty blown away. The second time we visited this establishment was this past weekend. We ordered the strawberry buttermilk flavor, which was an extra $1 than the other flavors. The extra cost would've been fine, but the ice cream this time was disappointing. It was very fluffy but not that creamy, and the strawberry flavor tasted more generic than expected, and it was difficult to tell where the buttermilk came in. In addition, they forgot our order, so we ended up waiting for over 15 minutes. The staff was not even that apologetic about it, which didn't help either. Overall, I would give this place a 3.5 stars, but since that's not an option, if I had to choose 3 or 4, I would go with 3.
author: Mariko M.

description: Very very good ice cream.but this place is a big mess. There are never cones. Definitely not in the weekend and ridiculous mess while waiting
author: Idan T.

description: I've been to a couple of their locations and the ice-cream is just fabulous. Quality over quantity meaning the portions are small but the ice-cream is very decadent so you don't need a large serving.
author: Laura H.

description: If there's a manager reading this, here's our experience last night: your staff messed up both the orders in front of us (it's ice-cream, not rocket-science); your cashier was on her cell phone the entire time we were there; all three of your garbage cans were 100% full and overflowing; your overly young staff was mostly congregating to the side and chatting loudly, and one was even sitting on a stool in the main room. In short, it was more like a zoo than an ice cream parlor. For your exorbitant prices, I expected so much better.
author: Rob R.

description: Cool place, excellent waffle. Poor choice of flavors although some are interesting. Ice cream are too creamy (fat) and way too sweet.
author: Benjamin O.

description: Smitten ice cream is my favorite and I tried almost all flavors. Came to this location for the first time and ordered off of the menu posted on the front door just to discover they had another seasonal flavor not on the menu, which happens to be my favorite flavors-coffee. I've never tried smitten coffee ice cream and although enjoyed my tcho chocolate, left disappointed that I didn't try coffee. Either update the menu or get rid of it altogether!
author: maria b.
